name: Roasted Mixed Potatoes with Fresh Herbs and Burrata
description: For my herbs, I used fresh dill, basil, and chives. Very light and springy, but they pack an herby punch.
recipeIngredient: 1 medium lemon, zested and juiced, divided
4 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil, divided
kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
¼ cup roughly chopped fresh dill
¼ cup roughly chopped basil leaves

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C).
Toss potatoes, lemon juice, 2 tablespoons olive oil, garlic, and a small pinch each of kosher salt and pepper together on a large baking sheet.
Roast in the preheated oven for 20 minutes. Toss and continue roasting until golden and crisp, 20 to 25 minutes more.
Meanwhile combine remaining 2 tablespoons of olive oil, dill, basil, chives, and lemon zest in a small bowl. Season with salt and pepper.
Remove potatoes from the oven and transfer to a serving plate. Tear burrata cheese into pieces and place over top. Drizzle with lemon-herb mix and serve.

aggregateRating.itemReviewed: Roasted Mixed Potatoes with Fresh Herbs and Burrata

review.reviewBody: 9.10.21 I bought a bag of mixed baby potatoes and quartered them. Went to 2 stores, neither had burrata.  I Google’d for a substitute which said fresh mozzarella, so that’s what I used.   I was a little concerned about roasting the small potatoes for a total of 40-45 minutes @ 450ºF, that’s really hot.  I lined my baking sheet with non-stick foil, checked the potatoes at 15 minutes, and they were already very brown and sticking a bit to the foil, so I flipped them.  Checked again at 10 minutes, and they were not only totally cooked but starting to dry out.  At t this point, I removed them from the oven at a total of 25 minutes cooking time, so I’d suggest you keep an eye on them. A little overdone, however, they actually tasted very good.  I’ll try these again at 400ºF which is typically what I use for roasting veggies.  Just need to get the timing right for my oven to get this a 5-star rating.  Thanks for sharing your recipe.
